title: Reported browser resolution is 1536×722
content:
I am using firefox 85.0 and this issue still exist in 84.0

In browserleaks.com amiunique.org coveryourtracks.eff.org my browser reported my resolution as 1536x722 which the "722" height part was weird.

I am having 1920x1080 and 125% zoom level in windows 10 home 1909. some quick math: 1536 is normal because 1920/1.25=1536 but how come the 722 was?

I am worried by this issue. This problem probably will make me more unique in browser fingerprinting.

i have privacy.resistFingerprinting = True and some extensions, also i disabled "navigator" and "screen" api on "CanvasBlocker" extensions

I also searched this problem but didn't end up with a clear answer. Someone said its cause by firefox tool bar, someone said tor browser also has this problem. I totally don't know what's happening.

I need help!
creator: 123erichappy123

title: eBay item advertised display pictures (and sub-pictures below main picture) not clickable/expandable
content:
In just the last day, since the Firefox 85 update, I have not been able to click on eBay advertisement pictures to get them to expand so I can view them full screen (using eBay's image viewer I assume).

here is an imgur video of me trying to click the picture, please note the "javascript:;" in the bottom left as I click the images . . . 

      imgur.com/a/Uww46VF

I've also loaded a couple of images of the tracking exception I added and a Firefox "Inspector" screenshot of the page and some error indicated at the bottom of that Firefox "Inspector" related to eBay pages.

I did use Safari yesterday or the day before, which I've recently updated as well. I almost NEVER use Safari or Chrome etc. because Firefox is superior in EVERY way shape and form, including security, speed, innovation and quality of experience. I can honestly say I used those other browsers only in the last week or so and only for a very limited use.

I'm no expert at all, so I'm going to make a pure wild guess, that the problem has to do with some javascript update done by the other browsers (Safari specifically) or something done by a stupid 3rd party gaming site (ScoreDB dot io, I ran yesterday, which I should be much smarter than to even consider using), which appears to have now done some type of harm to my beloved Firefox in some way. I should say as well I do not know if this is just a temporary eBay glitch or not as it has only been doing this for about 1 to 2 days.

I did turn off the "Enhanced Tracking Protection" for eBay as suggested in other articles but no effect even after reloading etc. I've rebooted and restarted everything as well but still no change.

Any help much much much appreciated to help return my Firefox to full health!

title: Janela não maximiza
content: Trabalho com o um sistema online e uso um notebook com um segundo monitor ligado na porta HDMI. Ela fica "grande", mas o botão de maximização ainda continua lá ativo, como se não tivesse sido feito corretamente a maximização. E notei que, nesse mesmo sistema, quando trabalho no computador da firma, consigo maximizar a janela normalmente, sem esses problemas. O que poderia ser? title: Problemas para importar el Certificado digital de la FNMT en Firefox (Manjaro)
content:
Hola a todos,

Recientemente migré de Windows a Manjaro. Decidí utilizar Firefox como navegador principal pero estoy teniendo problemas al importar mi certificado digital de la FNMT. Voy a Preferencias > Privacidad y Seguridad > Ver certificados > Personas > Importar. Tras hacer esto se me abre Gestor de archivos de Firefox (Dolphin), pero cuando seleciono el certificado digital y le doy abrir no hace nada, no lo importa ni me pide la contraseña ni nada. Probé con Chromium para asegurarme de que no fuese culpa del certificado en si, y lo importó correctamente. Uso la versión 85.0 de Firefox. Gracias de antemano!

title: QNAP Console disconnects after login
content:
Hello Everyone,

I have a QNAP NAS installed since last year and for most of the time I was able to login to its admin interface using Firefox with no issues

As of late I found that when I navigate to the URL and login, I get disconnected and taken back to the login page instantly

I have tried using different scenarios: 

- Cleared the cache - Disables all add-ons - Used a private window - Started Firefox in safemode

None of these solutions work

I know it's not an issue with the NAS because I can connect using other browsers (Chromium, Brave and Edge)

Any idea why this is happening?

Firefox is my main browser and I would love to keep using it for my NAS management

Thanks and regards, John

title: pop up blocker with bookmarklet
content:
Hello, We run a website that uses a bookmarklet button which allows us to capture the current URL location and save it. This is placed on the Tool Bar where its easy for a user to use. Until now, its been working perfectly but with this latest update to FireFox we are seeing the pop-up blocking being activated with the yellow message bar at the top. Now this would be ok if we only had to allow the pop up once (by clicking allow site), but unfortunately the bookmarket button has to be able to work on all sites, which is the whole point of the button. So its impractical to keep allowing it every time its used. Disabling the pop-up blocker completely then works, but then the browser is open to other pop-ups. Is there any way to allow bookmarklets to display a pop up and not display a pop-up message? Without having to disable the entire pop-up functionality. Can the FF developers allow for user placed bookmarklets to not be pop-up blocked. Maybe an exception added for that. They are placed manually by the user so are allowed by the user only.

Thanks for reading. Paul.
creator: paul319

title: Silent uninstall shows Cleaning Assistant page
content:
Silently uninstalling Firefox ESR 78.7.0 and 78.6.1 with helper.exe /S shows an Installer Dialog page instead of running fully silent. In german the heading in the Installer Dialog Window is "Stattdessen Firefox bereinigen?" (see screenshot). Dont't know the exact translation to the english version. Technically it asks for starting a cleaning assistant.

Any chance to deactivate this with another silent switch? Is it a bug?

Official docs tell me that the /S switch alone should be enough: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/silently-install-uninstall-firefox-enterprise

Using MSI Package is no option.

Regards Rolf

title: Bookmark visibility and 'icon' problem
content:
Hello, very recently started to use Firefox rather than Chrome and it is taking a little time to learn so apologies if there is an obvious solution to this!!

I have been merrily adding bookmarks (after importing existing ones from Chrome) and they have all worked well (including inserting folders etc) until one to this site:

https://www.voipcheap.co.uk/dashboard

I have added an image to show 2 views on my Firefox installation to demonstrate.

I added it into a sub folder (I thought) but it did not appear. I added it directly to the main Bookmarks toolbar and it did not appear. I played around for a while and thought I had solved it - when looking at the Bookmarks in Sidebar view I can see a folder (that I created) and inside it is a bookmark to the site. Trying it to view it by clicking through from the main toolbar window does not show it.

I am lost at what might be the problem - so if anyone is willing to try adding the site as a favourite in various places and anything else, if it does work can you help me get it to work in my installation with any suggestions? Just for completeness, please add it first as a favourite on the toolbar directly where I could not get the basic globe icon to appear.

The only non standard thing I have done (on my desktop machine) is to add an extension that gives me colours rather than the standard greys but I have not used this yet on my laptop - the problem is the same but without the colours.

title: How to restore bookmark backup when sync is active?
content:
Hi I am encountering a strange issue. I have two firefox computers and syncing is active.

I am trying to restore a previous version of my bookmarks (using the bookmarks library, Import and backup menu, restore function). My problem is that at one of the following sync (ie within usually a couple of hours max) the previous set of bookmarks is systematically restored by sync.

I have un-registered / re-registered both computers, tried to use a different backups (from recent history or from a file export), tried to run sync immediately after the restore... nothing helps.

I activated log on success for sync. Apparently the restore is just ignored as I get this: Sync.Engine.Bookmarks.BookmarkSyncUtils DEBUG pushChanges: Processed change records: {"weak":0,"skipped":0,"updated":0} and later, suddenly the browser realises that lots of bookmarks are missing and cancels all the changes: " Sync.Engine.Bookmarks.BookmarkSyncUtils DEBUG pushChanges: Processed change records: {"weak":0,"skipped":0,"updated":4764} "

Has anyone faced the same issue? Is there a way to force a unidirectional push from the browser to the server? Thanks

PS: FF 85, one on Win10 and the other on MacOS Big Sur. Same behaviour on both machines. PPS: The machines are in two different locations. It is impossible for me to force the change simultaneously on both computers.
creator: alex.v

title: Can't fix SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL as described
content:
Hi all,

while playing (or better "fighting"...) with a linux docker container on Win10/WSL2/Ubuntu for using the MS spfx tool chain, I generated a SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL in FF85.0/Win10 by first setting up a certificate exception for a dev-cert (https://localhost:4321) and then have the certificate re-created.

As described the support article [https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/Certificate-contains-the-same-serial...], I removed all certificate exceptions for localhost:* and deleted the "gulp" authority in options/security/certificates.

Unfortunately, the SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL persists even after a restart of firefox.

Any help is very much appreciated...

Thanks & greetings Markus Fehn

title: Do firefox use the same account on Windows and Mac?
content:
I am new to firefox. I created a firefox account in firefox browser in Windows first, and imported bookmarks, etc., from my chrome browser. Next I installed firefox in my Ubuntu OS, and it worked fine, the account can be logged-on and everything was synced.

I get the problem when I install firefox on my Mac. I installed the same firefox browser version as I installed on my Windows, except that it was for the Mac. I tried to log-on with the account before, but it asked me to create a new account, even if I use the same email address to register my firefox account before on Windows. So, do firefox use the same account on Windows and Mac? Is there a fix to this problem?
